page.title: 06Agriculture in Morwenstow
page.content: Farming is the dominant industry in this area. An average farm covers 50 hectares and supports a dairy herd of 60-80, 50-60 ewes plus followers and fattening stock with a permanent work force of two. The majority are run as a family business and have remained in the family for several generations. Daily work is undertaken by farmer and son for which purpose adequate implements are maintained. Contractors are employed for harvest and specialised tasks when large and expensive equipment is needed. The primary workhorse is the tractor. Electricity has now reached all the farms in the area and caters for lighting, barn and milking machinery. Milk is collected by bulk tanker for home consumption. The responsible use of chemicals and concern for wild life aids conservation
